user_input: Please create a full script for ppt slides number 3 and add the script to the slide notes.

  Text content: The AI chip and supercomputer supply chain involves complex processes including cutting-edge manufacturing, packaging, assembly, and testing. NVIDIA collaborates closely with industry leaders Amkor and SPIL for packaging and testing operations in Arizona.

In the next four years, NVIDIA aims to invest up to $500 billion in U.S.-based AI infrastructure, working with partners such as TSMC, Foxconn, Wistron, Amkor, and SPIL. These partnerships enhance NVIDIA's global footprint, create new business opportunities, and strengthen supply chain resilience.

edit target content:
The AI chip and supercomputer supply chain involves complex processes including cutting-edge manufacturing, packaging, assembly, and testing. NVIDIA collaborates closely with industry leaders Amkor and SPIL for packaging and testing operations in Arizona.

In the next four years, NVIDIA aims to invest up to $500 billion in U.S.-based AI infrastructure, working with partners such as TSMC, Foxconn, Wistron, Amkor, and SPIL. These partnerships enhance NVIDIA's global footprint, create new business opportunities, and strengthen supply chain resilience.
content after edit:
The AI chip and supercomputer supply chain involves several advanced stages: manufacturing, packaging, assembly, and testing. NVIDIA partners closely with industry leaders Amkor and SPIL for packaging and testing, focusing on operations in Arizona.

Over the next four years, NVIDIA plans to invest up to $500 billion in U.S.-based AI infrastructure. Key partners include TSMC, Foxconn, Wistron, Amkor, and SPIL. These collaborations aim to expand NVIDIA's global presence, open new business avenues, and bolster supply chain resilience.

In the next four years, NVIDIA aims to invest up to $500 billion in U.S.-based AI infrastructure, working with partners such as TSMC, Foxconn, Wistron, Amkor, and SPIL. These partnerships enhance NVIDIA's global footprint, create new business opportunities, and strengthen supply chain resilience.
content after edit:
The AI chip and supercomputer supply chain entails complex and advanced processes such as manufacturing, packaging, assembly, and testing. NVIDIA partners with industry leaders Amkor and SPIL, who handle packaging and testing operations at their facilities in Arizona.

Over the next four years, NVIDIA plans to invest up to $500 billion in AI infrastructure across the U.S., collaborating with key partners including TSMC, Foxconn, Wistron, Amkor, and SPIL. These strategic collaborations expand NVIDIA's global presence, open new business avenues, and bolster supply chain resilience.
